original_definition: 'reserve replacement process' means a process to restore the activated FRR and, additionally for GB and IE/NI, to restore the activated FCR;
generated_definition: 'reserve replacement process' means a process where tsos of an lfc block have the right to implement a reserve to ensure stability and security of the power system.

Article 3: ‘reserve replacement process’ or ‘RRP’ means a process to restore the activated FRR and, additionally for GB and IE/NI, to restore the activated FCR;
‘reserve replacement process’ or ‘RRP’ means a process to restore the activatedFRRand, additionally for GB and IE/NI, to restore the activatedFCR;
Article 160: 1.   All TSOs of anLFC blockshall have the right to implement areserve replacement process.
1.   All TSOs of an LFC block shall have the right to implement a reserve replacement process.
